welcome: Squeak is an open-source Smalltalk programming system with fast execution environments for all major platforms. It features the Morphic framework, which promotes low effort graphical, interactive application development and maintenance. Many projects have been successfully created with Squeak. They cover a wide range of domains such as education, multimedia, gaming, research, and commerce.

screenshots.caption: Tools for browsing, searching, and writing Smalltalk code
Run-time information in concurrent debugging sessions with direct code updates
Script, explore, and study almost everything in the environment
Automatic change tracking and distributed source code versioning tools

features.title: It's Smalltalk!
features.html: Everything is an object. Objects collaborate by exchanging messages to achieve the desired application behavior. The Smalltalk programming language has a concise syntax and simple execution semantics. Novice programmers can get started easily and experts can engineer elegant solutions at large.

features.title: Morphic UI Framework
features.html: All graphical objects are tangible and interactively changeable. This promotes short feedback loops and low-effort application development. Morphic thus leverages the live programming experience of traditional Smalltalk environments from a mainly text-focused domain to a graphical one.

features.title: Fast Virtual Machine
features.html: The CogVM is a virtual machine that supports Smalltalk and other languages of the Smalltalk family. Just-in-time compilation, stack-to-register mapping, and aggressive in-line message caching yield efficiency in interpreting Smalltalk byte code.

features.title: Powerful Tooling
features.html: The dynamic Squeak environment provides many tools for browsing, writing, executing, and versioning Smalltalk code. Multiple debugging sessions can be served concurrently. Thanks to Morphic, tool customization can be achieved with reasonable effort.

features.title: Build Your Own VM
features.html: VMMaker allows any programmer to build a customized virtual machine for any platform. A subset of Squeak/Smalltalk, called Slang, is sufficient to write almost everything of the VM. Slang code will be translated to C.

features.title: Web Development
features.html: With Seaside, Squeak can be a web server.

community.title: Squeak Mailing Lists
community.html: The Squeak community maintains several mailing lists for beginners, general development, and virtual machines.

community.title: Squeak Wiki
community.html: The Squeak Wiki collects useful information about the language, its tools, and several projects. It's a wiki, so you can participate!

community.title: The Weekly Squeak
community.html: The Weekly Squeak is a blog that documents news and other events in the Squeak and Smalltalk universe.

community.title: More Mailing Lists
community.html: The Smalltalk universe spreads across many different dialects, countries, and implementations. There are other lists in its support.

projects.title: Etoys
projects.html: Etoys is a media-rich authoring environment with a simple, powerful scripted object model for many kinds of objects created by end-users that runs on many platforms. It is free and open source. Etoys includes 2D and 3D graphics, images, text, particles, presentations, web pages, videos, sound and MIDI, etc.

projects.title: Scratch
projects.html: Create and share stories, games, and animations with Scratch. It helps young people to think in a creative fashion, conclude logically, and work together. Scratch is a project of the Lifelong-Kindergarten-Group at the MIT Media Lab.

projects.title: Seaside
projects.html: Seaside provides a layered set of abstractions over HTTP and HTML, that let you build highly interactive web applications. It is ported to and maintained for several Smalltalk dialects.

projects.title: Aida
projects.html: Aida is a Smalltalk web application framework for building web applications. It seamlessly integrates HTML5 technologies such as MVC, REST, Mobile, and WebSockets for today's real-time Web.
